definitions.text: a period of time (4 or 2 hours) during which some of a ship's crew are on duty
a purposeful surveillance to guard or observe
the period during which someone (especially a guard) is on duty
a person employed to keep watch for some anticipated event
the rite of staying awake for devotional purposes (especially on the eve of a religious festival)
follow with the eyes or the mind
examples: Keep an eye on the baby, please!
She followed the men with the binoculars
This program will be seen all over the world
They watched as the murderer was executed

definitions.text: be vigilant, be on the lookout or be careful

examples: Watch how the dog chases the cats away

definitions.text: find out, learn, or determine with certainty, usually by making an inquiry or other effort
examples: I want to see whether she speaks French
find out if he speaks Russian
Check whether the train leaves on time
